verses.roman:
sarva-lokera utkaṇṭhā yabe atyanta bāḍila
mahāprabhu dakṣiṇa haite tabahi āila

synonyms: sarva-lokera—of all people; utkaṇṭhā—anxieties; yabe—when; atyanta—very much; bāḍila—increased; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; dakṣiṇa haite—from South India; tabahi—at that very time; āila—returned.
translation: When all the residents of Jagannātha Purī became extremely anxious to meet the Lord again, He returned from South India.
